ENGLISH LANGUAGE SERVICES, INC.
PROFESSIONAL SERVICES IN THE FIELD OF ENGLISH AS A FOREIGN LANGUAGE
800 Eighteenth Street, N. W., Washington 6, D. C. • Telephone 393-5121 • Cable Address: Rosetta
December 11, 19^3
Office of Research and Development
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue
Washington 36, D.C.
Dear Mr. Fellows:
Thank you for your letter of October 30> in which you outline the re¬
quirements of the "English hy Radio" program we have discussed previously
on an informal basis. I want to apologize for this delay in replying to
your letter. As you know, I was in the Middle East during most of the
month of November.
We have had several informal discussions with you concerning the proposed
"English by Radio" project which the N.A.E.B. is undertaking as part of a
contract with the United States Information Agency. Based on these dis¬
cussions and the outline of specifications provided in your recent letter,
I am pleased to write you that English Language Services, Inc. would be
pleased to undertake the preparation of the sixty-five radio scripts for
a basic English course.
Specifically, ELS proposes the following:
1. Under the terms of a sub-contract with the N.A.E.B., ELS
will create and develop the required written prospectus
and the sixty-five completed fifteen-minute radio scripts
for a basic English course.
2. As required in the successful completion of the project,
ELS will make available its professional recording studios
and its engineering staff for taping the completed radio
scripts.
3. Throughout the proposed developmental project, ELS will
work closely with the N.A.E.B. and, if desired with repre¬
sentatives of the United States Information Agency. It is
mutually agreed that regular and frequent consultation will
Mr. James A. Fellows
Assistant Director
